thread.title: NBL 2015/16: burning questions heading into round 3, Melbourne United, Sydney Kings, Perth Wildcats, Adelaide 36ers
thread.title_full: NBL 2015/16: burning questions heading into round 3, Melbourne United, Sydney Kings, Perth Wildcats, Adelaide 36ers

author: Olgun Uluc
title: NBL 2015/16: burning questions heading into round 3, Melbourne United, Sydney Kings, Perth Wildcats, Adelaide 36ers
text:
Video Image Mark Bradtke: Cracking start to the NBL season 3:15 NBL: Just two weeks into the NBL season, every team has secured a win. Melbourne Tigers legend Mark Bradtke disccuses the action so far.
October 19th 2015 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Basketball/ Cedric Jackson of the Breakers looks to steal the ball from Casey Prather of the Wildcats.
Olgun Uluc FOX SPORTS HOW will Corey Webster’s return help New Zealand? Will Melbourne and Perth remain undefeated? Will the Kings bounce back after a tough round two?
Here are five burning questions heading into round 3 of NBL action.
Corey Webster is expected to make his return to the New Zealand Breakers this week. Source: News Corp Australia
Can Corey Webster’s return revamp the Breakers?
The New Zealand Breakers have had their struggles so far this season, losing both of their round two match-ups to see the reigning champions fall to last place on the NBL ladder.
On the bright side, hometown guard Corey Webster has returned to the club after an unsuccessful NBA trial, and is expected to give the team a massive lift. Webster will rejoin star import Cedric Jackson as one of the most dynamic back-court duos in the league, with the hopes of successfully defending their championship.
NBL WRAP: ROUND 2
BULLETS SECURE BOOMERS COACH FOR NBL RETURN
Can the Kings bounce back?
After an impressive season debut, the Kings seem to have fallen flat, losing their last two games as they search desperately for another victory.
Josh Childress’s injury has kept him sidelines for longed than expected and it’s still not known whether he’ll suit up for Sydney’s matchup against New Zealand on Wednesday night, but one thing is for sure, they’ll need him back soon if they’re to compete for a top-4 spot this season.
Sydney Kings import Marcus Thornton is beginning to get into rhythm heading into round three. Source: News Corp Australia
Will new import Jerome Randle make his debut?
An unfortunate shoulder injury has seen Kenyon McNeail released from the 36ers, with veteran American guard Jerome Randle expected to swiftly take his place.
The 36ers are attempting to have Randle ready by Thursday night’s game against the Taipans, but with such short notice, it’s likely he may have to wait until Friday night’s matchup against the Sydney Kings.
Will Melbourne move to 5-0 after two home games?
Melbourne is the clear favourite so far this season, and with two home games in round three, five wins in a row could be very possible.
Townsville has shown some fight throughout the season, and Cairns have showed glimpses of brilliance, but Melbourne’s talent and depth may be too much for both teams as they look to remain undefeated.
Hakim Warrick battles in traffic. Source: News Corp Australia
Can Illawarra give Perth their first loss?
Apart from Melbourne, Illawarra is arguably the hottest team in the league right now, dominating on both ends of the floor during both of their impressive round two wins.
Perth aren’t a particularly flashy team, but they’re yet to lose a game so far this season, with Illawarra their biggest threat entering round three. With the return of Boomers guard Damian Martin, can the Wildcats get to 4-0 by the end of the week?
Damian Martin fit for Wildcats 0:37 NBL: Boomers guard Damian Martin should hit the boards for the first time when the undefeated Perth Wildcats meet Townsville.
October 20th 2015 14 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Basketball/ NBL Round 3: Five burning questions
